description:
This modules defines a set of functions for managing persistent, ordered, and updatable collections.

Such collections are identified by a URI as defined in the XQuery specification. However, please note that we do not advise users to use collections identified by URIs. Instead, we refer to the data lifecycle documentation. It gives an overview of several ways to work with collections, documents, and other data-structures.
authors: <xqdoc:author xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">Matthias Brantner, David Graf, Till Westmann, Markos Zaharioudakis</xqdoc:author>

functions.name: available-collections
functions.description:
The function returns a sequence of URIs of the collections that are
 available. The sequence will be empty if there are no collections.
functions.summary: The function returns a sequence of URIs of the collections that are available.

returns.description: A sequence of URIs, one for each available collection, or an emtpy sequence.

functions.name: create
functions.description: Creates the collection with the given URI.
functions.summary: Creates the collection with the given URI.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The URI of the collection to create.

returns.description: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, creates a collection with the given URI.

errors: zerr:ZDDY0002 if a collection identified by $uri already exists.

functions.name: create
functions.description:
Creates the collection with the given URI and adds copies of the given
 sequence to the new collection.
functions.summary: Creates the collection with the given URI and adds copies of the given sequence to the new collection.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The URI of the collection to create.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The sequence of nodes to add to the new collection.

returns.description: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, creates a collection identified by $uri and inserts $content into it.

errors: zerr:ZDDY0002 if a collection identified by $uri already exists.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Deletes the collection with the given URI.
functions.summary: Deletes the collection with the given URI.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The URI of the collection to delete.

returns.description: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, deletes the collection identified by $uri.

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.</xqdoc:error>
zerr:ZDDY0015 if any of the in-scope variables reference a node that belongs to the collection identified by $uri.

functions.name: from-qname
functions.description:
THIS FUNCTION IS FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY.
 Gets the namespace component of the given QName.
functions.summary: THIS FUNCTION IS FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The QName whose namespace component should be returned.

functions.name: is-available-collection
functions.description: Checks whether a collection with the given URI exists.
functions.summary: Checks whether a collection with the given URI exists.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: The URI of the collection to check.

returns.description: true if the collection is available and false otherwise.

functions.name: to-qname
functions.description:
THIS FUNCTION IS FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY.
 Converts a URI given as a string into a reserved QName.
 This QName is used in the module to be able to store collections identified
 by URIs using dynamic collections that are identified by QNames.
functions.summary: THIS FUNCTION IS FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY.

parameters.name: uri
parameters.description: URI to convert to a reserved QName.

returns.description: The reserved QName for the given URI.
